title: Incoherent impls are allowed on opaque types

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
I tried this code: ```rust #![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)] type X = impl Sized; fn f() -> X {} trait Y { fn g(&self) {} } impl Y for X<()> {} impl Y for X {} fn main() { f::<()>().g(); } ``` I expected to see this happen: error for potentially overlapping impls Instead, this happened: ICEs in codegen ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.46.0-nightly (346aec9b0 2020-07-11) binary: rustc commit-hash: 346aec9b02f3c74f3fce97fd6bda24709d220e49 commit-date: 2020-07-11 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.46.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ```
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: src\librustc_trait_selection\traits\codegen\mod.rs:62:17: Encountered error `Unimplemented` selecting `Binder(<() as Y>)` during codegen thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src\librustc_errors\lib.rs:916:9 stack backtrace: 0: ::fmt 1: core::fmt::write 2: ::fmt 3: std::panicking::take_hook 4: std::panicking::take_hook 5: rustc_driver::report_ice 6: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook 7: ::fmt 8: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::err_count 9: rustc_errors::Handler::bug 10: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 11: ::fmt 12: ::fmt 13: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 14: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 15: unicode_normalization::normalize::is_hangul_syllable 16: rustc_trait_selection::traits::codegen::codegen_fulfill_obligation 17: rustc_ty::provide 18: crc32fast::Hasher::finalize 19: crc32fast::Hasher::finalize 20: crc32fast::Hasher::finalize 21: rustc_ty::provide 22: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::features_query>::hash_result 23: ::lift_to_tcx 24: rustc_middle::ty::structural_impls::::lift_to_tcx 25: ::fmt 26: rustc_middle::ty::instance::Instance::resolve 27: ::visit_terminator 28: ::visit_impl_item 29: rustc_mir::monomorphize::collector::collect_crate_mono_items 30: ::fmt 31: rustc_mir::monomorphize::collector::collect_crate_mono_items 32: rustc_mir::monomorphize::partitioning::compute_codegen_unit_name 33: as rustc_codegen_llvm::type_of::LayoutLlvmExt>::pointee_info_at 34: ::fmt 35: rustc_codegen_llvm::type_::::reg_backend_type 36: rustc_codegen_llvm::type_::::reg_backend_type 37: as rustc_codegen_llvm::type_of::LayoutLlvmExt>::pointee_info_at 38: ::codegen_crate 39: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::print_stats 40: rustc_interface::passes::BoxedResolver::complete 41: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::ongoing_codegen 42: ::partial_relro 43: ::fmt 44: ::deref 45: ::deref 46: <(&rustc_middle::ty::sty::Const,rustc_middle::mir::Field) as rustc_middle::ty::query::keys::Key>::default_span 47: std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new 48: BaseThreadInitThunk 49: RtlUserThreadStart note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.46.0-nightly (346aec9b0 2020-07-11) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc query stack during panic: #0 [codegen_fulfill_obligation] checking if `Y` fulfills its obligations #1 [resolve_instance] resolving instance `<() as Y>::g` #2 [collect_and_partition_mono_items] collect_and_partition_mono_items end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error ```
